issues.description: Return type mismatch for Farm.singFarmSong(): The problem UML (and the template) specify singFarmSong() as returning void (it should print the song). The solution implementation instead declares public String singFarmSong() and returns the song text. This divergence changes the public API and the expected behavior (printing vs. returning text) and will confuse students about whether they should print the song or return it, and may break tests or the intended usage shown in the template/Main.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the solution follow the specification/template by changing singFarmSong() to return void and perform printing (or alternatively update the problem statement and template to document/expect a String-returning method). The least disruptive fix for students is to change the solution signature to public void singFarmSong() and print the song lines directly (or call a helper that prints lines).

issues.description: Inconsistent helper method signature/behavior for singFarmSongVerse: the template declares a private helper as a void method (private void singFarmSongVerse(/*Animal animal*/)) and uses printing inside it (parameter is commented out), while the solution implements a private String singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal) that returns the verse text. Both the parameter presence and the return-vs-print behavior differ between template and solution, which can confuse students about whether they should implement a parameterized helper that prints or one that returns a String.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the helper method across artifacts. Either: (a) update the solution so singFarmSongVerse(Animal animal) is private void and prints the verse (matching the template's printing approach and the exercise's intent), or (b) update the template and problem statement to show/use a helper that returns a String and have singFarmSong() assemble/return the combined song. Prefer option (a) to preserve the original exercise intent (printing the song).
